string-array.name: bubble
string-array.item: Sorts an array by swapping the adjacent elements if they are in the wrong order
Iterates Through array and see if succeeding number if less than the current number
If the current number is less than the succeeding number the two numbers swap
After each iteration the next number starting from the back is sorted

string-array.name: insertion
string-array.item: A simple sorting algorithm that builds the final sorted array one item at a time
Starting with the second item in the array for as long as the number to the left is less than the current number swap current number with the number on its left
This is done for each preceding number in array until we reach the end of the array

string-array.name: merge
string-array.item: Sorts an array by swapping the adjacent elements if they are in the wrong order
The algorithm starts by splitting the array half then split those halves in half until there is until each subarray is size one
Each pair of halves is sorted then sorts as they merge with each other
This method can be looked at as similar to divide and conquer but they sort as they conquer

string-array.name: quick
string-array.item: Picks an element as pivot and partitions the given array around the picked pivot
Select a pivot of your choosing
Put all items lower than the pivot to its left and all items larger than the pivot to its right, the pivot is now sorted
Repeat the above step for the right side of the pivot as a sub array and do the same for the right side of the pivot

string-array.name: heap
string-array.item: First the maximum element is found and then placed at the end, the the process is repeated for each remaining element
Puts array in heap
Change heap to max heap (A max heap states that a parent node is always greater than or equal to its child node)
Take the root and swap it with the last node in the heap
Remove or ignore that node as part of the heap because it has just been sorted
Since the array is already in a heap, repeat the rest of the steps to sorted the rest of the nodes in the heap or the rest of the elements in the array

string-array.name: selection
string-array.item: Starting from the beginning of the array, sets the next item in the array to be the minimum value in the array
Iterates through array to find a lower value then the minimum value and swaps it with the old minimum value making it the new minimum value
Each preceding item in the array will be sorted starting from the front after each iteration

string-array.name: for_loop
string-array.item: A form of iteration where a block code is repeated where the “for” statement contains where the loop starts, where the loop ends and how long the loop will be running for.
Starts by typing “for”
Enters the starting point of the loop followed by a semicolon
Enters the condition that will keep the loop repeating followed by a semicolon
Enters the incrementer
A completed “for loop” statement

string-array.name: while_loop
string-array.item: A form of iteration where a block of code is repeated for as long as the condition in the while statement is true
Starts by typing “while”
Enters the condition that will keep the loop going, the loop will exit when that condition becomes false
A completed “while loop” statement

string-array.name: do_while_loop
string-array.item: A form of iteration where a block of code is executed before the condition in the while statement is checked. The same block of code will then be repeated for as long as the condition in the while statement is true.
Starts by typing “do”
Enters the block of code to be repeated
Followed by the word “while”
Enters the condition that will keep the loop going, the loop will exit when that condition becomes false
A completed “do while loop” statement

string-array.name: get_length
string-array.item: A method used to return the number of characters in a String.

string-array.name: replace
string-array.item: A method used to search a string for a specified value, or a regular expression, and returns a new string where the specified values are replaced.
